quote: Peace, like charity, begins at home.
A bone to the dog is not charity. Charity is the bone shared with the dog, when you are just as hungry as the dog.
A kiss: To a young girl, faith; to a married woman, hope; and to an old maid, charity.
A kiss: To a young girl, faith; to a married woman, hope; to an old maid, charity.
A man receiving charity always hates his benefactor- it is a fixed characteristic of human nature.
A rich man without charity is a rogue; and perhaps it would be no difficult matter to prove that he is also a fool.
Behold I do not give lectures or a little charity, When I give I give myself.
Censorship, like charity, should begin at home, but unlike charity, it should end there.
Charity and beating begins at home.
Charity begins at home, and justice begins next door.
Charity begins at home, and justice begins next door.
Charity begins at home, but should not end there.
Peace, like charity, begins at home.

Charity and beating begins at home.
Charity begins at home, and justice begins next door.
Charity begins at home, and justice begins next door.
Charity begins at home, but should not end there.
Charity begins at home.
Charity creates a multitude of sins.
Charity is injurious unless it helps the recipient to become independent of it.
Charity is injurious unless it helps the recipient to become independent of it.
Charity is no substitute for justice withheld.
Charity is the scope of all God's commands.
Charity should begin at home, but should not stay there.
Charity: a thing that begins at home, and usually stays there.
Christian life consists of faith and charity.
Did universal charity prevail, earth would be a heaven, and hell a fable.
Flatter not thyself in thy faith in God if thou hast not charity for thy neighbor.
Having leveled my palace, don't erect a hovel and complacently admire your own charity in giving me that for a home.
I am as comfortless as a pilgrim with peas in his shoes - and as cold as Charity, Chastity or any other Virtue.
I think patriotism is like charity - it begins at home.
If you haven't got any charity in your heart, you have the worst kind of heart trouble.
In charity there is no excess.
In faith and hope the world will disagree, But all mankind's concern is charity.
In necessary things, unity; in doubtful things, liberty; in all things, charity.
Never a sound judgment without charity.
Never let your zeal outrun your charity. The former is but human, the latter is divine.
One of the serious obstacles to the improvement of our race is indiscriminate charity.
Only great souls know the grandeur there is in charity.
Real progress is progress in charity, all other advances being secondary thereto.
Slander is a poison which kills charity, both in the slanderer and the one who listens.
The charity that hastens to proclaim its good deeds, ceases to be charity, and is only pride and ostentation.
The charity that is a trifle to us can be precious to others.
The Jews and the Arabs should settle their dispute in the true spirit of Christian charity.
The living need charity more than the dead.
The organized charity, scrimped and iced, in the name of a cautious, statistical Christ.
The worst of charity is that the lives you are asked to preserve are not worth preserving.
Too many have dispensed with generosity in order to practice charity.
